title: How to Fix Palings or Pickets

steps.headline: Be sure to paint, stain, varnish etc, the palings or pickets before you work with them.
steps.description: This also applies to the posts and rails that will form part of the fence. It is much easier to paint etc. before you attach the palings.

steps.headline: Measure how many you will need to cover each span of rails from post to post.
steps.description: You will need to space the palings or pickets as described below.

steps.headline: Run a line of string at the base of the palings.
steps.description: This will form the line along which you will nail the palings to the fence rail.

steps.headline: Nail the palings into place along the string line.
steps.description: Use galvanized flathead nails, two nails per joint; if you need better grip, try angle nails.

steps.headline: Space the palings.
steps.description: Use a block of wood to space palings or pickets to provide consistent spacing between each one.

steps.headline: Draw a line in chalk across the top of the palings to mark the desired height of your fence.
steps.description: Be sure to keep it straight and consistent across all the palings. Cut the palings at this height, moving along the chalk line. Most pickets do not need to be cut as they already have their typical triangular shape in place (see image above).

text: Be sure to paint, stain, varnish etc, the palings or pickets before you work with them. This also applies to the posts and rails that will form part of the fence. It is much easier to paint etc. before you attach the palings. Measure how many you will need to cover each span of rails from post to post. You will need to space the palings or pickets as described below. Run a line of string at the base of the palings. This will form the line along which you will nail the palings to the fence rail. Nail the palings into place along the string line. Use galvanized flathead nails, two nails per joint; if you need better grip, try angle nails. Space the palings. Use a block of wood to space palings or pickets to provide consistent spacing between each one. Draw a line in chalk across the top of the palings to mark the desired height of your fence. Be sure to keep it straight and consistent across all the palings. Cut the palings at this height, moving along the chalk line. Most pickets do not need to be cut as they already have their typical triangular shape in place (see image above).
